item.title: The Unicorn S02E12 영어 표현
item.author: Author
item.description: 1. fast 단식하다, 절식하다; 금식하다. - Wade: Aren’t you supposed to fast when you have a colonoscopy? 2. account 이유. - Michelle: Look, I know you’re trying to be nice to Meg on my account, but you don’t have to be. 3. break off sth to end a relationship. - Wade: I mean, I know we

item.title: Modern Family S01E06 영어 표현
item.author: Author
item.description: 1. have/know sth down pat to know something so well that you can say or do it without having to try or think. - Jay: I wasn’t the greatest husband the first time around, but, I’m tyring to do better this time. And maybe by my third marriage, I’ll have it down pat. 2. mean to ~ 할 셈이다. - Phil: What ya reading there? A book?

item.title: The Unicorn S02E08 영어 표현
item.author: Author
item.description: 1. give off 풍기다. - Jared: Uh, this is a liability release form. I need you and your husband to sign it. - Shannon: What? Him? - Wade: Yo-You thought that we were together? - Shannon: That’s so funny. No, no, no, no, no. - Wade: No, we’re not together. I mean, we came here together, but we’re not married or anything. - Shannon: Do we give

item.title: B Positive S01E07 영어 표현
item.author: Author
item.description: 1. table to delay discussion of a subject. - Gina: I can see your lips moving, but I can not hear you talking. - Drew: Uh… Why don’t we table this for later? 2. get under sb’s skin to annoy someone. - Gina: She said my crazy kidney guy left her a snarky-ass message about how great I am that really got under her skin. 3. be/get carried away to

item.title: The Unicorn S02E06 영어 표현
item.author: Author
item.description: 1. flat out 딱 부러지게, 완전히. - Cynthia: And I love his family and his dogs, but I told him flat out, I won’t do that with Butch in the room. 2. ill at ease feeling anxious and not relaxed. - Wade: Yeah, uh, Forrest got a deal online, but they make him nervous. - Forrest: Nah, more ill at ease, let’s say.

item.title: B Positive S01E06 영어 표현
item.author: Author
item.description: 1. grow a pair [Verb] (vulgar,idiomatic) To be brave; to show some courage, especially in a situation in which one has so far failed to do so. - Gideon: You’re a shrink. Can’t you get a copy of the eval and coach her through it? - Drew: Oh, no, no. I couldn’t. That would be cheating. - Samantha: Grow a pair, Bambi. 2. take the high road to behave in

item.title: Modern Family S01E02 영어 표현
item.author: Author
item.description: 1. put one’s foot down 단호한 태도를 취하다. - Phil: Sometimes a man’s gotta put his foot down and do what a man’s gotta do. 2. rub sb the wrong way to annoy someone without intending to. - Mitchell: Her future best friend might be in that class, and I don’t wanna rub anyone the wrong way. 3. start sb off 1. ~

item.title: Modern Family S01E01 영어 표현
item.author: Author
item.description: 1. tell someone off to tell someone that they have done something wrong and that you are angry about it. 야단 치다. - Soccer Mom: Come on, Coach. You gotta take that kid out. - Gloria: You wanna take him out? How about I take you out? - Jay: Honey, honey. - Gloria: Why don’t you worry about your son? He spent the first half with his

item.title: Modern Family S01E16 영어 표현
item.author: Author
item.description: 1. get off to …으로 시작하다. - Cameron: We got off to an awkward start with our pediatrician, a very nice Asian lady named Dr. Miura. 2. queen a gay man. - Cameron: Why do you think the dentist gives me all that free stuff? - Mitchell: Um, because he’s a huge queen and he has a big crush on you. 3. by all

item.title: Modern Family S01E15 영어 표현
item.author: Author
item.description: 1. shoot over 빨리 가다. - Cameron: We’re gonna shoot over to Great Shakes, get a table. 2. pull off (힘든 것을) 해내다[성사시키다]. - Cameron: Now, if we can pull this off, you and your little lady friend will be belly up to a ice cream counter having a milk shake with two
